item.title: 巴西扩建顶级深水油田加剧全球石油短缺
item.description: 在原油价格徘徊在五年低点附近、全球市场为供应过剩做好准备之际，巴西国有石油公司正在加快世界最大深水油田的生产。【原文：Brazil’s state oil company is accelerating production from the world’s biggest deep-water field as crude prices hover near a five-year low and the global market braces for glut.】

item.title: 微软与 OpenAI 达成交易后将开发超级智能技术
item.description: 微软公司正在开发一种更强大的人工智能，称为 "超级智能"，希望它能在医学和材料科学等领域取得进步。【原文：Microsoft Corp. is pursuing a more powerful form of AI called “superintelligence” it hopes will be capable of making advances in areas like medicine and materials science.】

item.title: 可自动赎回交易所交易基金指南
item.description:
一种复杂的新投资方式引起了金融界的极大兴趣。Calamos Investments 的马特-考夫曼（Matt Kaufman）解释道。【原文：

A complex new way of investing has peaked the interest of the financial world. But what are these ETFs? Calamos Investments’ Matt Kaufman explains. 

】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会调查伊根-琼斯公司的信用评级行为
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，美国证券交易委员会一直在对伊根-琼斯评级公司（Egan-Jones Ratings Co.【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission has been scrutinizing Egan-Jones Ratings Co., according to people familiar with the matter, delving into the business practices of a leader in the fast-growing market for private-credit ratings.】

item.title: 铜和银加入美国修订后的重要矿产清单
item.description: 随着特朗普政府扩大其认为对美国经济和国家安全至关重要的商品的范围，美国将铜、银和铀列入政府的重要矿产清单。【原文：The US added copper, silver and uranium to a government list of critical minerals as the Trump administration broadens its scope of what commodities it deems vital to the American economy and national security.】

item.title: 雷诺 Twingo 重获新生，成为一款售价低于 20,000 欧元的城市电动汽车
item.description: 雷诺汽车公司（Renault SA）展示了其新款电池驱动的 Twingo 城市汽车，欧洲汽车制造商正试图提供更多经济实惠的电动汽车，以回击中国竞争对手。【原文：Renault SA presented its new battery-powered Twingo city car as Europe’s automakers try to offer more affordable electric vehicles to fight back against Chinese rivals.】

item.title: Worldline 首席执行官表示，改革计划将彻底解决故障问题
item.description: Worldline SA 首席执行官皮埃尔-安托万-瓦谢龙（Pierre-Antoine Vacheron）表示，周四公布的扭亏为盈计划旨在永久性地解决这家陷入困境的支付服务提供商在筹集 5 亿欧元资金后存在的不足。【原文：Worldline SA Chief Executive Officer Pierre-Antoine Vacheron said a turnaround plan unveiled Thursday aims to permanently address deficiencies at the embattled payments provider following a €500 million capital raise.】

item.title: 比利时将预算推迟至 12 月，避免政府崩溃
item.description: 比利时为确保 2026 年的预算设定了新的年终最后期限，从而暂时避免了政府垮台，但却延长了国内政局的不稳定性。【原文：Belgium has set a new year-end deadline to secure a budget for 2026, avoiding a government collapse for now but prolonging political instability in the country.】

item.title: 印度监管机构讨论允许银行进行大宗商品交易
item.description: 印度证券市场监管机构和中央银行正在探讨允许商业贷款机构进行商品衍生品交易的前景，此举旨在深化该资产类别的流动性。【原文：India’s securities market regulator and its central bank are exploring the prospect of allowing commercial lenders to trade in commodity derivatives, a move aimed at deepening liquidity in the asset class.】

item.title: 巴西利用债务市场掀起 2010 年以来最热潮
item.description: 巴西今年将第四次出售美元债券，利用投资者对高收益债务的需求激增，这可能是巴西自 2010 年以来最繁忙的一年。【原文：Brazil is looking to sell dollar bonds for the fourth time this year, taking advantage of a surge in investor appetite for high-yielding debt to notch what could be its busiest annual spree since 2010.】

item.title: 瑞典绿色钢铁企业被发现雇佣非法移民工人
item.description: 位于瑞典北部的斯泰格拉公司（Stegra AB）计划建造的绿色钢铁厂发现了非法移民，这给这家急于获得额外资金的公司带来了更大的压力。【原文：Illegal immigrants have been found working at Stegra AB’s planned green steel plant in northern Sweden, adding yet more pressure on a company that’s racing to secure extra funds.】

item.title: 法国极右翼视欧洲央行宽松政策为债务问题的解决方案
item.description: 法国极右翼领导人乔丹-巴尔德拉（Jordan Bardella）表示，如果该党执政，将推动欧洲中央银行重启量化宽松政策。【原文：French far-right leader Jordan Bardella said his party will push the European Central Bank to relaunch quantitative easing if it comes to power.】

item.title: 巴伐利亚竞购者在投资者反对后放弃收购要约
item.description: Nordic Capital 和 Permira 放弃了对巴伐利亚北欧公司（Bavarian Nordic A/S）的收购要约，因为他们的甜美要约未能赢得足够的投资者支持。【原文：Nordic Capital and Permira dropped their takeover bid for Bavarian Nordic A/S after their sweetened offer failed to win enough investor support.】

item.title: Stagwell 跃升 85%，首席执行官期待 Palantir 协议带来 2026 年的增长
item.description: Stagwell Inc. 与 Palantir Technologies Inc. 合作开发了一个新的人工智能驱动平台，旨在减少营销活动中使用的代理数量，之后该公司股价大涨。【原文：Stagwell Inc. shares soar after partnering with Palantir Technologies Inc. for a new AI-driven platform which aims to reduce the number of agents used in marketing campaigns.】

item.title: Peloton 在收到受伤报告后召回 83.3 万辆 Bike+ 自行车
item.description: Peloton Interactive Inc.公司在美国自愿召回约83.3万辆高端Bike+型号产品，因为有报告称部分座椅支柱断裂，导致用户摔下。【原文：Peloton Interactive Inc. issued a voluntary recall on about 833,000 units of its high-end Bike+ model in the US following reports that some seat posts broke, causing users to fall off.】

item.title: 全球支付公司开始为 Worldpay 交易出售 62 亿美元债券
item.description: 全球支付公司（Global Payments Inc.【原文：Global Payments Inc. is looking to raise $6.2 billion in the corporate bond market to help support its acquisition of a stake in Worldpay inc.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比表示对无数据情况下的降息感到不安
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，政府停摆期间缺乏通胀数据让他对继续降息更加不安。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said a lack of inflation data during the government shutdown makes him more uneasy about continuing interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: 英国航空公司所有者与马斯克的 Starlink 公司签署 Wi-Fi 协议
item.description: 英国航空公司（British Airways）的所有者 IAG SA 与 SpaceX 的 Starlink 公司签署了一项协议，为该航空公司集团的所有五家航空公司提供机上 Wi-Fi 服务。【原文：British Airways owner IAG SA inked a deal with SpaceX’s Starlink for inflight Wi-Fi across all five carriers in the airline group.】

item.title: 美国新关税疑虑将如何在贸易伙伴间演绎
item.description: 最高法院对唐纳德-特朗普总统利用广泛的权力来证明其大规模关税的合理性提出质疑，这使得实际支付征税的企业面临数月的潜在不确定性。【原文：The Supreme Court’s questioning of President Donald Trump’s use of broad powers to justify much of his sweeping tariffs leaves businesses that actually pay the levies facing months of potential uncertainty.】

item.title: 中国特使敦促英国在不确定性中加强对话
item.description: 中国外交部长王毅对英国外交大臣伊薇特-库珀（Yvette Cooper）说，在全球紧张局势不断加剧的情况下，两国应加强战略沟通以稳定关系，并警告说双边关系可能有倒退的风险。【原文：Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi told UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper their countries should strengthen strategic communication to stabilize ties amid rising global tensions, warning that their bilateral relations may risk backsliding.】

item.title: 大选结果加剧通胀担忧，捷克按兵不动
item.description: 捷克决策者连续第四次会议维持利率不变，因为下届政府预算计划的不确定性加剧了对通货膨胀的担忧。【原文：Czech policymakers kept interest rates unchanged for a fourth straight meeting as uncertainty over the next government’s budget plans compounds inflation worries.】

item.title: 康菲石油公司以通货膨胀为由将柳树成本提高至 90 亿美元
item.description: 康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）以通货膨胀和其他成本上升为由，将阿拉斯加柳树石油和天然气项目的总支出计划提高到多达 90 亿美元。【原文：ConocoPhillips raised its total spending plans for the Willow oil and natural gas project in Alaska to as much as $9 billion, citing inflation and other rising costs.】

item.title: 尼日利亚投资 6.18 亿美元的科技孵化器完成首次投资
item.description: 尼日利亚进行了首次直接投资，以支持由技术驱动的初创企业，因为尼日利亚正努力支持一个已将商业资本拉各斯发展成为非洲重要科技中心的行业。【原文：Nigeria made its first direct investment to support technology-enabled startups, as it seeks to back a sector that has already grown commercial capital Lagos into a key tech hub for Africa.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚 "牛仔 "债券首席工程师：反弹充满风险
item.description: 哈维尔-奎利亚尔正在下很大的赌注。他对此毫不避讳。哥伦比亚公共信贷总监奎利亚尔在启动一项价值 90 亿美元的瑞士法郎、美元和比索的复杂债务交易时宣称，他所冒的风险之大在该国历史上绝无仅有。【原文：Javier Cuellar is making very large bets. He doesn’t shy from this. Upon launching a complex $9 billion debt deal in Swiss francs, dollars and pesos, Cuellar, Colombia’s public credit director, declared the risk he was taking was so great it had no precedent in the country’s history.】

item.title: 美国页岩油运营商不畏 60 美元油价继续增产
item.description: 美国页岩油公司正在推进其生产计划，以适应 60 美元的油价，同时小幅增加产量，为该行业明年创纪录的供应过剩埋下伏笔。【原文：US shale companies are forging ahead with their production plans, adapting to $60 oil prices while grinding out small increases and setting up the industry to add to next year’s record supply glut.】

item.title: 罕见的帕加尼超级跑车附带价值 3,000 万美元的迈阿密顶层公寓
item.description: 迈阿密的豪华房地产市场自大流行病以来一直蓬勃发展，价格屡创新高。【原文：In Miami’s luxury real estate market, which has boomed like few others since the pandemic with record-setting prices, developers are turning to ever flashier concepts to stand out.】

item.title: 高额电费正在左右美国大选
item.description: 随着数据中心和新工厂需求的增加，电力成本已成为一个全国性的热点问题。【原文：Electricity costs have become a national hot-button issue as data centers and new factories drive up demand.】

item.title: 消费者节俭促使约翰老爹公司下调指导价，导致该公司业绩下滑
item.description: 约翰爸爸国际公司（Papa John's International Inc.【原文：Papa John’s International Inc. shares dropped after comparable sales unexpectedly shrunk and the pizza chain slashed its outlook, as diners — particularly low-income ones — skimped on dining out.】

item.title: 亚马逊跃升 3,000 亿美元，让人工智能话题重回股票市场
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）的股价在今年大部分时间里一直受到该公司云计算业务被竞争对手甩开的担忧的困扰。这些担忧暂时得到了平息。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. shares have been dogged for most of the year by concerns the company’s cloud-computing business was losing ground to rivals. Those fears have been put to rest for the time being.】

item.title: 贸易商权衡越南台风对出口的影响，罗布斯塔下跌
item.description: 罗布斯塔咖啡期货在伦敦下跌，原因是交易商权衡了来自世界头号咖啡豆种植国越南的更强劲出货量与预计将袭击该国主要产区的台风之间的利弊。【原文：Robusta coffee futures fell in London as traders balanced stronger shipments from Vietnam, the world’s top grower of the bean variety, against a typhoon expected to hit the nation’s key producing region.】
